9.5.18  6:23 pm   When I record a minor key keyboard solo in a song, I like to play the solo in C minor/C blues and then just transpose up or down as needed. I do this partially because I like the position of the black keys in Cmin (makes for good"slideability"), but also because I just feel more comfortable playing in that key. I feel like I've gotten more used to playing there that I can go to the moon and back easier than in other keys. Do you think I should probably do the smart thing and just get better and more comfortable going wild in all 12 keys, or should I just stick to what's easiest and what I'm best at?

9.5.18  3:05 am   Do you consider yourself separate from other things?

     Like, that space is what differentiates us from any object? Or perhaps the opposite, in that space is what bridges one thing to th next. That if all things were to stop being considered "things" at all,the concept of these supposed things being separate would fall apart. It would reveal perhaps that everything is part of the same instance of happening in a continuous process of what one might call existence.
